meanings.definition: Treat in an indulgent or overprotective way.
meanings.sent1: She would always coddle her pet cat, giving it extra treats and cuddles.
meanings.sent2: Parents sometimes coddle their children by doing everything for them.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy lady would coddle her tiny dog by carrying it everywhere in a designer bag.
meanings.sent4: The overprotective mother would coddle her son so much that he struggled to do things on his own.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would coddle the shy student, always offering encouragement and support.

meanings.definition: Cook (an egg) in water below boiling point.
meanings.sent1: To make a soft-boiled egg, you need to coddle it gently in hot water.
meanings.sent2: I prefer to coddle my eggs rather than hard boil them for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to coddle the eggs for the salad to add a creamy texture.
meanings.sent4: She learned how to coddle eggs perfectly after watching a cooking show.
meanings.sent5: The recipe called for coddling the eggs to achieve the desired consistency.

meanings.sent1: The grandparents would coddle their grandchild with gifts and treats.
meanings.sent2: Some people believe it's important to coddle themselves with self-care activities.
meanings.sent3: He would coddle his girlfriend with flowers and love notes every day.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy heiress was used to being coddled and pampered by her staff.
meanings.sent5: The spa offered a luxurious package to coddle guests with massages and facials.
